intro: Chuquiraga luetzelburgii, commonly known as the Andean burro's tail, is a perennial flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
